fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Business and Industry, Single market, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives:
(1)  ICT Standardisation policy, e.g., Regulation EU 1025/2012  
(2)  Digital Single Market initiatives 
(3)  Inter-government and government-to-business (G2B) Open Data requirements and regulations 
(4)  NIS (cybersecurity) Directive 
(5)  Data Protection Regulation
organisation_name: Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Systems (OASIS)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
OECD IT Advisory Council 
ISO/IEC/ITU e-Business Memorandum of Understanding Management Group
goals__remit: OASIS is a nonprofit consortium that drives the development, convergence and adoption of open standards, open code and open data for the global information society.  OASIS is one of the largest and oldest standards consortia in the Internet and ICT domain.  OASIS promotes industry consensus and produces worldwide standards for cybersecurity, the Internet of Things, cloud computing, energy, e-commerce, content technologies, emergency management and crisis response, and other areas.
relevant_communication: OASIS acts as a host organization for the collaborative ICT open standards, open source code and open data  projects of experts and stakeholders from industry, public administration and academia, promoting the development of interoperable data structures, both open source and commercial software tools,  and business process policies and methods.  There are over 70 OASIS technical committees, each housing a defined project;  OASIS publishes the output of each of those projects, and also hosts and co-hosts periodic conference events in support of those projects.
